title: IaC: Configure AWS Secrets Manager for DB Credentials
description: Use Terraform to create a secret in AWS Secrets Manager to store the master database username and password. Define an IAM policy that grants read access to this secret.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: A secret containing DB credentials is created in Secrets Manager. An IAM policy allowing read access is defined. `terraform apply` is successful.
definition_of_done: Terraform code merged. Resources provisioned and verified in dev environment.
testing_requirements: Verify secret retrieval via AWS CLI with an assumed role.
deployment_notes: Part of the initial infrastructure deployment.
business_value: Secures database credentials, a critical security best practice.

title: IaC: Define Networking Layer (VPC, Subnets, etc.)
description: Create the foundational networking infrastructure using Terraform. This includes the VPC, public/private subnets in 2+ AZs, NAT Gateways, and Security Groups.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: VPC and all related networking resources are provisioned via `terraform apply`. Resources in private subnets have outbound internet access. Security groups are defined.
definition_of_done: Terraform code merged. All networking resources verified in AWS console.
testing_requirements: Connectivity tests from bastion hosts.
deployment_notes: Prerequisite for almost all other AWS resources.
business_value: Creates the secure and isolated network environment for the application.

title: IaC: Provision PostgreSQL RDS Instance
description: Define and provision the AWS RDS PostgreSQL instance via Terraform, ensuring Multi-AZ, automated backups (14-day retention), PITR, and encryption at rest are enabled.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: RDS instance is provisioned successfully. Configuration in AWS console matches all requirements (Multi-AZ, backups, encryption).
definition_of_done: Terraform code merged. RDS instance verified in console.
testing_requirements: Verify successful application connection from a test environment.
deployment_notes: Requires networking and secrets to be in place.
business_value: Provides the persistent, highly-available data store for the application.

title: IaC: Define AWS Cognito User Pool with Terraform
description: Create the Terraform configuration for the Cognito User Pool, specifying the password policy and app client settings for the Authorization Code flow with PKCE.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: Terraform code defines a Cognito User Pool with a strong password policy. An App Client is defined with PKCE enabled. `terraform apply` successfully provisions the resources.
definition_of_done: Terraform code merged. Cognito resources verified in AWS console.
collaboration_required: Frontend team for callback URL configuration.
testing_requirements: Manual verification of settings in the AWS console.
business_value: Provides the managed identity provider for all user authentication and authorization.

title: FE: Initialize React Project & Core Dependencies
description: Initialize the React project using Vite+TS and install all core frontend dependencies (Redux Toolkit, Material-UI, etc.). Set up basic project structure, linting, and formatting rules.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: The project can be installed and run locally. All required libraries are in `package.json`. ESLint and Prettier are configured.
definition_of_done: Project skeleton pushed to repository. Local development environment is functional.
testing_requirements: Successful local run and linting of the initial project.
deployment_notes: First step for all frontend development.
business_value: Creates the codebase and development environment for the frontend application.

title: FE: Implement Main Responsive Layout Component
description: Implement the main application layout with a responsive header, content area, and footer using Material-UI's grid system. This includes the collapsible 'hamburger' menu for mobile.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: Layout correctly switches between single-column (mobile) and multi-column (desktop). Navigation collapses on viewports < 768px. No horizontal scrolling on mobile.
definition_of_done: Component merged. E2E tests passing for multiple viewports.
testing_requirements: Manual testing on different browser sizes and E2E tests using Cypress's `cy.viewport()`.
deployment_notes: Forms the UI shell for the entire SPA.
business_value: Provides the consistent, high-quality user experience required on any device.

title: FE: Implement Registration UI Form
description: Create the `Register.tsx` page component with Material-UI, including fields for email, password, password confirmation, and a checkbox for ToS acceptance. Implement all required client-side validation.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: The form renders correctly and is responsive. Client-side validation provides immediate feedback. The 'Register' button is disabled until the form is valid.
definition_of_done: Component tests passing. Manual interaction verified.
testing_requirements: Component tests for validation logic and manual interaction testing.
deployment_notes: Part of the user onboarding flow.
business_value: Provides the user-facing interface for account creation.

title: FE: Implement Cognito Registration Logic
description: Implement the client-side service logic to handle the registration form submission. This involves initiating the redirect-based registration flow with the Cognito Hosted UI.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: Submitting the valid registration form redirects to Cognito. After successful registration, user is redirected back to the application's callback URL and a session is established.
definition_of_done: E2E test of the full registration flow is passing.
testing_requirements: E2E test of the full registration flow, including redirection.
deployment_notes: Requires correct Cognito App Client and callback URL configuration.
business_value: Implements the core logic for securely creating new user accounts.

title: FE: Implement Login UI Form
description: Create the `Login.tsx` page component with fields for email and password. Implement client-side validation for required fields.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: The form renders correctly and is responsive. The 'Log In' button is disabled if fields are empty.
definition_of_done: Component tests passing.
testing_requirements: Component tests.
business_value: Provides the user-facing interface for authentication.

title: FE: Implement Cognito Login Flow (PKCE)
description: Implement the client-side service logic to handle the login form submission. This includes generating the `code_verifier` and `code_challenge`, redirecting to Cognito, handling the callback, and exchanging the auth code for JWTs.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: Login flow correctly follows the OAuth 2.0 Auth Code with PKCE standard. Upon successful login, the application receives and securely stores tokens.
definition_of_done: E2E test of the full login flow, inspecting network requests for PKCE parameters, is passing.
testing_requirements: E2E test inspecting network requests for `code_challenge` and `code_verifier`.
business_value: Implements the secure logic for authenticating returning users.

title: Backend: Initialize NestJS Project & Configure DB Connection
description: Set up the NestJS backend monorepo workspace. Configure TypeORM to connect to PostgreSQL, fetching credentials from AWS Secrets Manager.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: Project bootstraps and runs locally. On startup, the application successfully connects to the database using credentials from Secrets Manager.
definition_of_done: Application logs show successful DB connection on startup.
testing_requirements: Run application locally and check logs for DB connection success.
deployment_notes: Base setup for all backend development.
business_value: Creates the backend application codebase and connects it to the data persistence layer.

title: DB: Design and Script Initial Schema Migrations
description: Create the initial TypeORM migration scripts for the `users`, `custom_modes`, `user_variables`, and `calculation_history` tables. This includes all columns, data types, foreign keys, and unique constraints.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: TypeORM migration files are created for all required tables. Running the migrations successfully creates the schema in a local PostgreSQL database. All constraints are correctly defined.
definition_of_done: Migration scripts are merged. Schema verified in a test database.
testing_requirements: Successful execution of migration scripts and schema inspection.
deployment_notes: Critical for backend functionality. Must be run by CI/CD pipeline before app deployment.
business_value: Defines the data structure for all application features.

title: Backend: Implement JWT Authentication Guard for NestJS
description: Create a NestJS authentication guard using Passport.js to validate Cognito-issued JWTs. The guard will fetch the public keys from Cognito's JWKS endpoint to verify the token signature.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: The guard correctly validates a valid JWT. The guard rejects requests with invalid, expired, or missing tokens with a 401 status. The authenticated user's details are attached to the request object.
definition_of_done: Integration tests passing for valid and invalid tokens.
testing_requirements: Integration tests that mock requests with valid and invalid tokens.
deployment_notes: Security-critical component that protects all backend APIs.
business_value: Provides the server-side mechanism to secure the application's APIs.

title: CI/CD: Setup Backend CI Workflow
description: Create the GitHub Actions workflow file for the backend. It must install dependencies, run lint, unit tests, and integration tests using a service container for PostgreSQL. Enforce 85% coverage.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational AWS infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines.
acceptance_criteria: Workflow triggers on push. A PR with failing tests or coverage below 85% is blocked. Workflow completes successfully for valid code.
definition_of_done: Workflow is running and enforcing quality gates on all PRs.
testing_requirements: Successful and failing workflow runs on GitHub for test PRs.
business_value: Automates quality assurance, ensuring code health and preventing regressions.

title: FE: Implement Core Math Expression Parser Logic
description: Implement the core logic for the client-side math expression parser. This task focuses on basic arithmetic (+, -, ร, รท), numbers, parentheses, and respecting the order of operations (PEMDAS).
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional scientific calculator with persistent history.
acceptance_criteria: The parser correctly evaluates expressions like `5+3*2` to 11. It handles decimals and negatives. It throws specific errors for invalid syntax and division by zero.
definition_of_done: Unit tests achieve >90% coverage for the parser logic.
testing_requirements: Passing unit tests covering all acceptance criteria and edge cases.
business_value: The 'brain' of the calculator; all other functions depend on this.

title: FE: Implement Basic Calculator Keypad and Display
description: Create the React components for the main calculator UI, including the number display, and buttons for digits, basic operators, equals, and clear.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional scientific calculator with persistent history.
acceptance_criteria: The keypad and display components render correctly. Clicking buttons appends the correct character to the input expression. The UI is responsive and accessible.
definition_of_done: Component tests passing. Manual interaction verified.
testing_requirements: Component tests and manual interaction in a storybook or dev environment.
business_value: The primary user interface for all calculator functions.

title: FE: Integrate Parser with UI
description: Connect the Keypad and Display components to the math expression parser. Pressing '=' should trigger the evaluation, display the result, and handle any errors.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional scientific calculator with persistent history.
acceptance_criteria: Entering `5+3=` displays `8`. Entering `8/0=` displays an error. The new result is added to the history state.
definition_of_done: E2E tests using Cypress are passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests using Cypress.
business_value: Activates the core calculator functionality, making it usable.

title: FE: Implement History Panel UI Component
description: Create the `HistoryPanel.tsx` component that displays a list of calculations from the Redux store and shows an empty state message when the list is empty.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional scientific calculator with persistent history.
acceptance_criteria: Component renders a list of history items. Component renders an 'empty state' message when history is empty. The panel is scrollable.
definition_of_done: Component tests and Storybook stories are complete.
testing_requirements: Component tests and Storybook.
business_value: Provides the UI for a core usability feature.

title: FE: Implement Redux Logic for Session History
description: Create a Redux slice (`historySlice.ts`) to manage the calculation history for the current session (anonymous user).
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional scientific calculator with persistent history.
acceptance_criteria: A `addHistory` action correctly adds a new item to the start of the history array. The state is managed immutably. The history is cleared on page reload for anonymous users.
definition_of_done: Unit tests for the slice are passing.
testing_requirements: Passing unit tests.
business_value: Enables state management for the history feature.

title: BE: Implement API Endpoints for Calculation History
description: Implement the `GET /history` and `POST /history` endpoints in the NestJS backend. The endpoints must be protected by the JWT guard and scoped to the authenticated user's ID.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional scientific calculator with persistent history.
acceptance_criteria: A user can POST a new history item. A user can GET a list of their own history items. An attempt to access another user's history is blocked with a 403/404 error.
definition_of_done: Integration tests for the history API are passing, including negative security tests.
testing_requirements: Passing integration tests, including IDOR vulnerability checks.
business_value: Provides the backend persistence layer for the calculation history feature.

title: FE: Integrate History Persistence with Backend
description: Use RTK Query to fetch the user's history upon login. After each local calculation, dispatch a mutation to POST the new history item to the backend.
sprint_goal: Deliver a functional scientific calculator with persistent history.
acceptance_criteria: On login, the history panel is populated with data from the API. Performing a new calculation triggers a POST request. The UI gracefully handles API errors.
definition_of_done: E2E tests and network inspection in browser dev tools confirm functionality.
testing_requirements: E2E tests and network inspection in browser dev tools.
business_value: Connects the frontend history feature to the persistent backend storage.

title: FE: Design and Implement Wizard Framework Component
description: Create a reusable `Wizard` container component that manages steps and overall state. Implement the first step for entering the mode's name and description.
sprint_goal: Build the core of the user-extensible framework: the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: The component can render different child components based on the active step. 'Next' and 'Back' buttons correctly transition between steps. State is maintained.
definition_of_done: Component tests are passing.
testing_requirements: Component tests.
business_value: The foundational UI for the entire custom mode creation flow.

title: FE: Implement Client-Side Formula Validation Service
description: Create a service that uses a math parsing library to parse a formula string. Traverse the AST to validate syntax, check for undefined variables, and ensure only allow-listed functions are used.
sprint_goal: Build the core of the user-extensible framework: the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: The service correctly identifies syntax errors, undefined variables, and disallowed functions.
definition_of_done: Unit tests for the service achieve >90% coverage.
testing_requirements: Extensive unit tests covering all validation cases.
business_value: The core logic for the real-time formula editor, improving UX significantly.

title: FE: Implement Formula Editor UI with Real-time Feedback
description: Create the `WriteFormulasStep.tsx` component. Integrate the validation service on a debounced input handler to provide real-time error messages and visual feedback.
sprint_goal: Build the core of the user-extensible framework: the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: As a user types, validation errors appear and disappear. The wizard's 'Save' button is disabled if any formula is invalid.
definition_of_done: Component and E2E tests are passing.
testing_requirements: Component and E2E tests.
business_value: The user-facing component for defining the logic of a custom mode.

title: BE: Implement Secure Sandbox Lambda Handler
description: Implement the Node.js handler for the formula execution Lambda. Use `isolated-vm` to create a secure sandbox, inject allow-listed functions, execute the formula, and return the result or an error.
sprint_goal: Deliver end-to-end custom mode execution and prepare for offline capabilities.
acceptance_criteria: The Lambda correctly executes valid formulas. It catches and returns errors for invalid formulas. It terminates and returns an error if a disallowed function is called or resource limits are exceeded.
definition_of_done: Unit tests and manual invocation via AWS console confirm all security and functional requirements.
testing_requirements: Unit tests for the handler logic and manual invocation via AWS console with malicious and valid payloads.
business_value: Provides the secure execution engine for the application's key differentiator feature.

title: FE: Implement Dynamic UI for Launched Custom Mode
description: Create the `ExecuteMode.tsx` page component. This component will fetch a custom mode's definition, dynamically render the necessary input fields, and provide a 'Calculate' button.
sprint_goal: Deliver end-to-end custom mode execution and prepare for offline capabilities.
acceptance_criteria: The page correctly renders a form based on a mode's JSON definition. The UI is responsive and accessible. A loading state is shown while fetching the mode definition.
definition_of_done: Component and E2E tests are passing.
testing_requirements: Component and E2E tests.
business_value: The user interface for actually using a custom mode.

title: FE/BE: Integrate UI with Formula Execution Service
description: Wire the 'Calculate' button in the `ExecuteMode` component to an API call that invokes the secure Lambda function. The frontend then displays the returned results or errors.
sprint_goal: Deliver end-to-end custom mode execution and prepare for offline capabilities.
acceptance_criteria: Clicking 'Calculate' sends the correct payload to the API. The API Gateway successfully invokes the Lambda. The frontend correctly displays the results or errors.
definition_of_done: E2E test is passing.
collaboration_required: Backend team for API Gateway and Lambda integration.
testing_requirements: End-to-end test.
business_value: The final integration step to make custom modes functional.

title: FE: Implement Service Worker for App Shell Caching
description: Configure and implement a service worker to cache the main application assets (HTML, JS, CSS). This enables the app to load and function offline after the first visit.
sprint_goal: Implement robust offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: The application loads from the cache when the browser is in offline mode. Core calculator functions are usable offline.
definition_of_done: E2E tests that simulate offline conditions are passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests that simulate offline conditions.
business_value: Enables the basic offline experience, a key NFR.

title: FE: Develop Offline Queue Service using IndexedDB
description: Implement the service that intercepts failed API mutations, serializes them, and saves them to an IndexedDB table. The UI should update optimistically.
sprint_goal: Implement robust offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: When offline, a data-changing action creates a record in IndexedDB. The UI reflects the change immediately. The service can correctly read and deserialize queued requests.
definition_of_done: Unit tests passing. Browser storage inspection confirms behavior.
testing_requirements: Unit tests and inspection of browser storage.
business_value: The persistence layer for offline changes, critical for data integrity.

title: FE: Implement Sync Manager and Conflict Resolution
description: Create the core logic that detects network reconnection, processes the IndexedDB queue, sends requests to the server, and handles responses, including 'last-write-wins' conflict resolution.
sprint_goal: Implement robust offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: Upon reconnection, queued requests are sent. Successfully synced requests are deleted from the queue. Handles 409 Conflict responses by updating local state with server data.
definition_of_done: E2E tests that simulate conflicts and successful synchronization are passing.
collaboration_required: Backend team for conflict response contract.
testing_requirements: E2E tests that simulate network conditions and API responses.
business_value: The orchestration logic for the entire offline feature, ensuring data consistency.
